title: Boston residents say they feel safer downtown compared to last year in new survey
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Survey shows 33.7% feel less safe in downtown Boston, down from 70.6% last year.
Downtown Boston Public Safety Summit addressed drug use, petty crime, and infrastructure concerns.
Retail vacancies downtown are at their lowest rate since COVID-19, linked to increased safety perceptions.

title: Patriots vs. Falcons live updates: Can Patriots extend win streak to six games?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots, led by Drake Maye, face the Atlanta Falcons' top-ranked pass defense at Gillette Stadium.
Rhamondre Stevenson is inactive for the Patriots due to a toe injury, possibly increasing reps for TreVeyon Henderson.
The 6-2 Patriots aim for a sixth consecutive win against the 3-4 Falcons, kickoff at 1 p.m. on CBS.

title: 10 defendants, including a grandma, indicted in statewide sex trafficking case
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Ten defendants indicted for trafficking multiple women in Essex, Middlesex, Plymouth, and Suffolk counties from March 2023 to September 2025.
Gianni Martinez of Lynn faces multiple charges including trafficking, deriving support from prostitution, and violating restraining orders.
Defendants, including Martinez's grandmother Rosa Garcia, allegedly forced victims to hand over payments and laundered money.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Miles Teller hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Miles Teller hosted the November 2 episode of 'SNL,' marking his second hosting stint on the show.
Brandi Carlile appeared as the musical guest for the fourth time, following her notable joint performance with Elton John.
The episode featured a political cold open with Teller in a mock New York City mayoral debate sketch.

title: Regulators are limiting a proposed Eversource rate hike in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts utility regulators blocked Eversource's proposed rate hike, saving customers millions on heating costs this winter.
The Department of Public Utilities cited Eversource's failure to meet three performance metrics including safety and emissions reductions.
Eversource warned the decision might lead to larger future rate hikes for its 300,000 NSTAR division customers.

title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School investigates a racist incident involving a plastic figure wearing a Black student's jersey in a locker room.
Principal Allyson Mizoguchi and Superintendent David Fleishman emphasize intolerance for hate and commit to actions promoting inclusion.
Wayland police and the Middlesex District Attorney's Office are collaborating in the investigation, planning a community response.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Kevin Durant led the Houston Rockets to a 128-101 victory, snapping the Boston Celtics' three-game winning streak.
The Celtics faced scheduling challenges, with the game marking their third in four days and fifth in seven.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, while Kevin Durant scored 26 points for the Rockets.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate RB D'Ernest Johnson from practice squad ahead of Sunday's game against the Falcons.
D'Ernest Johnson has seven years of NFL experience and may fill roles in both offense and special teams.
Injuries to Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson have depleted Patriots' running back depth for the matchup.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have improved the Bruins' defense, allowing just one goal in 73:24 of 5-on-5 ice time.
The Bruins' defense has strengthened, culminating in a 2-1 victory against Carolina, limiting them to one high-danger scoring chance.
Boston's defense rebounded due to Zadorov's physicality and the return of Hampus Lindholm, improving their record to 5-1-0 this season.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Joonas Korpisalo started consecutive games for the first time, following a 7-2 Bruins loss to Ottawa.
Jeremy Swayman stopped 27 of 28 shots in a 2-1 win against Carolina, marking Boston's third consecutive victory.
Swayman leads Korpisalo in save percentage and goals saved above expected, despite recent changes in goalie rotation.
